comments.author: John
comments.content:
I made this two days ago, at the other end of the season. It's been warm in New England and my garden's not yet frozen (until tonight!). That meant I harvested the last 2 dozen purple haze carrots, a bit of very chilly dill, and some similarly chilly caraway for garnish. I bought the radishes. I cut the carrots into pieces about 3/8" square x 5" long. Blanching them made them lose some of their lovely purple color, but otherwise it was a lovely dish. The leftovers were even MORE lovely this morning -- the purple of the carrots had seeped into the oil of the dressing to produce an almost scarlet color on everything. 

Anyhow...a big success. Next time, with late-season carrots, I'd probably use the microwave to cook them to avoid losing color. Otherwise, I wouldn't change a thing.
